Package org.kynosarges.tektosyne.demo

Class DesktopAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kynosarges.tektosyne.demo.DesktopAction

  • public final class DesktopAction
extends Object
    Encapsulates AWT Desktop actions. The AWT Desktop facility requires two separate tests before executing each Desktop.Action and throws exceptions for unsupported actions. DesktopAction provides a single test per action, silently does nothing if an attempted action is unsupported, and caches test results for all supported actions at startup.
    Version:
    6.0.0
    Author:
    Christoph Nahr

    • Method Detail

      • canBrowse

        public static boolean canBrowse​()
        Indicates whether the Desktop.Action.BROWSE action is supported.
        Returns:
        true if a Desktop exists and supports Desktop.Action.BROWSE, else false

      • browse

        public static boolean browse​(URI uri)
                      throws IOException
        Launches the default browser to display the specified URI. Returns false and does nothing if canBrowse() fails. See Desktop.browse(java.net.URI) for details and possible security exceptions.
        Parameters:
        uri - the URI to display in the default browser
        Returns:
        true if the action was attempted, else false
        Throws:
        IOException - if the default browser could not be launched
        NullPointerException - if uri is null

      • edit

        public static boolean edit​(File file)
                    throws IOException
        Launches the associated application to edit the specified File. Returns false and does nothing if canEdit() fails. See Desktop.edit(java.io.File) for details and possible security exceptions.
        Parameters:
        file - the File to edit with the associated application
        Returns:
        true if the action was attempted, else false
        Throws:
        IOException - if the associated application could not be launched
        NullPointerException - if file is null

      • mail

        public static boolean mail​(URI mailtoURI)
                    throws IOException
        Launches the default mail client with an optional mailto: URI. Returns false and does nothing if canMail() fails. See Desktop.mail() for details and possible security exceptions.
        Parameters:
        mailtoURI - an optional mailto: URI to fill message fields
        Returns:
        true if the action was attempted, else false
        Throws:
        IOException - if the default mail client could not be launched

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the action was attempted, else false
        Throws:
        IOException - if the associated application could not be launched
        NullPointerException - if file is null
